1.text: I say the truth in Christ, I lie not, my conscience also bearing me witness in the Holy Ghost,

2.text: That I have great heaviness and continual sorrow in my heart.

3.text: For I could wish that myself were accursed from Christ for my brethren, my kinsmen according to the flesh:

4.text: Who are Israelites; to whom [pertaineth] the adoption, and the glory, and the covenants, and the giving of the law, and the service [of God], and the promises;

5.text: Whose [are] the fathers, and of whom as concerning the flesh Christ [came], who is over all, God blessed for ever. Amen.

6.text: Not as though the word of God hath taken none effect. For they [are] not all Israel, which are of Israel:

7.text: Neither, because they are the seed of Abraham, [are they] all children: but, In Isaac shall thy seed be called.

8.text: That is, They which are the children of the flesh, these [are] not the children of God: but the children of the promise are counted for the seed.

9.text: For this [is] the word of promise, At this time will I come, and Sara shall have a son.

10.text: And not only [this]; but when Rebecca also had conceived by one, [even] by our father Isaac;

11.text: (For [the children] being not yet born, neither having done any good or evil, that the purpose of God according to election might stand, not of works, but of him that calleth;)

12.text: It was said unto her, The elder shall serve the younger.

13.text: As it is written, Jacob have I loved, but Esau have I hated.

14.text: What shall we say then? [Is there] unrighteousness with God? God forbid.

15.text: For he saith to Moses, I will have mercy on whom I will have mercy, and I will have compassion on whom I will have compassion.

16.text: So then [it is] not of him that willeth, nor of him that runneth, but of God that sheweth mercy.

17.text: For the scripture saith unto Pharaoh, Even for this same purpose have I raised thee up, that I might shew my power in thee, and that my name might be declared throughout all the earth.

18.text: Therefore hath he mercy on whom he will [have mercy], and whom he will he hardeneth.

19.text: Thou wilt say then unto me, Why doth he yet find fault? For who hath resisted his will?

20.text: Nay but, O man, who art thou that repliest against God? Shall the thing formed say to him that formed [it], Why hast thou made me thus?

21.text: Hath not the potter power over the clay, of the same lump to make one vessel unto honour, and another unto dishonour?

22.text: [What] if God, willing to shew [his] wrath, and to make his power known, endured with much longsuffering the vessels of wrath fitted to destruction:

23.text: And that he might make known the riches of his glory on the vessels of mercy, which he had afore prepared unto glory,

24.text: Even us, whom he hath called, not of the Jews only, but also of the Gentiles?

25.text: As he saith also in Osee, I will call them my people, which were not my people; and her beloved, which was not beloved.

26.text: And it shall come to pass, [that] in the place where it was said unto them, Ye [are] not my people; there shall they be called the children of the living God.

27.text: Esaias also crieth concerning Israel, Though the number of the children of Israel be as the sand of the sea, a remnant shall be saved:

28.text: For he will finish the work, and cut [it] short in righteousness: because a short work will the Lord make upon the earth.

29.text: And as Esaias said before, Except the Lord of Sabaoth had left us a seed, we had been as Sodoma, and been made like unto Gomorrha.

30.text: What shall we say then? That the Gentiles, which followed not after righteousness, have attained to righteousness, even the righteousness which is of faith.

31.text: But Israel, which followed after the law of righteousness, hath not attained to the law of righteousness.

32.text: Wherefore? Because [they sought it] not by faith, but as it were by the works of the law. For they stumbled at that stumblingstone;

33.text: As it is written, Behold, I lay in Sion a stumblingstone and rock of offence: and whosoever believeth on him shall not be ashamed.
